properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 12:07PM EST until February 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Northern Indiana
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a
Flood Warning for the following rivers...

Wabash River near Bluffton affecting Wells County

.Recent rainfall along with some snow melt has caused the Wabash river to rise and is expected to rise above flood stage midday Wednesday. This will be helped by additional precipitation late Wednesday into Wednesday night.

The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Wabash River near Bluffton
* from Wednesday morning to Saturday evening.
* At 12 PM Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Wednesday morning
and crest near 10.9 feet around 7 PM Thursday February 13 and fall
below flood stage around 7 PM Friday February 14.
* At 11.0 feet...River Road at Bluffton begins to flood. Flood waters
isolate the amphitheater at Kehoe Park in Bluffton.
* This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet which occurred
on Jan 1 2016.
properties.instruction:
Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep
to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood
waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further
statements and updated forecasts.

Detailed river forecasts and more information can be found on the
internet at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.

All times are in Eastern Time. This statement will be updated in
about 24 hours or sooner if necessary.
